author: rjstone
body:
Tried to use my profile from the Windows 10 bundled version of powershell. This is what happens.
## Steps to reproduce

Install PsGet along with the other modules and use this profile. (Everything but PsGet and PsColor could be removed from the profile most likely but here's the whole profile.

``` powershell
import-module PsGet
New-Alias im Install-Module -Force

import-module Find-String
New-Alias grep find-string -Force

Import-Module Invoke-ElevatedCommand
Import-Module PSSudo

function su { Start-Process PowerShell -Verb RunAs }

import-module PsUrl
import-module PSGnuwin32

import-module PsColor

# Load posh-git example profile
. 'C:\Users\Robert\Documents\WindowsPowerShell\Modules\posh-git\profile.example.ps1'

New-Alias which get-command -Force
New-Alias df Get-PSDrive -Force

# Get username:
[System.Security.Principal.WindowsPrincipal]$global:currentUser = New-Object System.Security.Principal.WindowsPrincipal([System.Security.Principal.WindowsIdentity]::GetCurrent())
if($global:currentUser.IsInRole([System.Security.Principal.WindowsBuiltInRole]::Administrator)) {
  $user = $global:currentUser.Identities.Name + " (Administrator)";
} else {
  $user = $global:currentUser.Identities.Name
}
(Get-Host).UI.RawUI.WindowTitle =  $user + " on " + [System.Net.Dns]::GetHostName() + " (v" + (Get-Host).Version + ")";
```

This is the version of posh included with Windows 10 on my system where this profile works fine. (This is not the version I'm having trouble with.)

``` powershell
C:\Users\Robert> $PSVersionTable

Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      5.1.14393.103
PSEdition                      Desktop
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}
BuildVersion                   10.0.14393.103
CLRVersion                     4.0.30319.42000
WSManStackVersion              3.0
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
```
## Expected behavior

All modules imported with no errors.
## Actual behavior

``` powershell
PowerShell
Copyright (C) 2016 Microsoft Corporation. All rights reserved.

Method invocation failed because [System.Environment] does not contain a
method named 'GetFolderPath'.
At C:\Users\Robert\Documents\PowerShell\Modules\PsGet\PsGet.psm1:12 char:5
+ if ([Environment]::GetFolderPath('MyDocuments')) {
+     ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
    + CategoryInfo          : InvalidOperation: (:) [], RuntimeException
    + FullyQualifiedErrorId : MethodNotFound

Add-Type : Cannot find path 'C:\Program
Files\PowerShell\6.0.0.10\System.ServiceProcess.dll' because it does not exist.
At C:\Users\Robert\Documents\PowerShell\Modules\PsColor\PSColor.psm1:2 char:1
+ Add-Type -assemblyname System.ServiceProcess
+ ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
    + CategoryInfo          : ObjectNotFound: (C:\Program File...viceProcess.d
   ll:String) [Add-Type], ItemNotFoundException
    + FullyQualifiedErrorId : PathNotFound,Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.AddTy
   peCommand

Loading personal and system profiles took 1013ms.
C:\Program Files\PowerShell\6.0.0.10>
```
## Environment data

``` powershell

C:\Program Files\PowerShell\6.0.0.10> $PSVersionTable

Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}
GitCommitId                    v6.0.0-alpha.10
PSVersion                      6.0.0-alpha
BuildVersion                   3.0.0.0
PSEdition                      Core
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
WSManStackVersion              3.0
CLRVersion
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
```

comments.author: bmanikm
comments.body: PsGet mentioned in this issue is different from the PowerShellGet module.

comments.author: rjstone
comments.body: Great... Now I feel like I've been "phished" into thinking that PsGet was PowerShellGet. Some things seem to be in both repos.

title: Errors importing PsGet and PsColor in profile
